sen.j: 高髻（こうけい）とは奈良時代の女性貴族の髪型。
sen.e: Kokei (high chignon) was hair style for noblewomen in Nara period.

sen.j: 唐の女性の髪形に取材したもので、類似したものに双髻（そうけい）、一髻（いっけい）がある。
sen.e: This hair style employed the hair style for ladies in Tang Dynasty in China as a model and hair styles similar to kokei were sokei (twin chignons) and ikkei (single chignon).

sen.e: A kind of ikkei, with mage (chignon) made on the top of the head and the hair on the back of the head hanging down was done by uneme who served the emperors even when Heian period started.

sen.j: 後ろ髪をまとめて頭頂部で髷を作る。

sen.e: The main portion of this mage includes two loops formed by dividing the end of the hair into two and using these ends, and the rest of the hair is wound at the foot of this mage in a cross shape and, thereby, kokei is completed.

sen.e: Ikkei: The hair above the forehead is divided into two at the center and are each coupled to the hair on the temple and are each folded back at the height at which the hair does not touch the shoulder to the top of the head to form mage.
